summary:
“Is it going to be just him or the rest of the Avengers?”
“Just him. No Black Widow or Hulk so you’re saved.”
“Yeah, but I have...
body:
Imagine: Tony Meets his Daughter’s Boyfriend

“Is it going to be just him or the rest of the Avengers?”

“Just him. No Black Widow or Hulk so you’re saved.”

“Yeah, but I have to impress your father who is the Tony Stark. I’m so nervous.”

“Love, you’ll be fine. Just be yourself and Dad will like you. Just don’t let him intimidate you otherwise you’ll be in the hole.”

“Thanks for the encouragement. I really need that.”

“You’re so cute. It’s gonna be great.”

BONUS:

“Daddy, this is my boyfriend.”

“Mr. Stark, it’s a pleasure to meet you. I’m—“

“I know who you are. I’ve seen all your records. Not Hydra or a spy. No criminal history except for one parking ticket.”

“So what are your intentions towards my daughter? Are they honorable? Respectful? Selfless?”

“Seriously?”

“Daddy.”

“Buckle up, boy. Impressing me ain’t gonna be no cakewalk.”

summary: I had a dream last night where I was exchanging emails with Tom Holland. But they were like... completely comprised of memes....
body:
I had a dream last night where I was exchanging emails with Tom Holland. But they were like… completely comprised of memes.

And I swear I laughed at the Justin Bieber one for like ten minutes straight.

There also was a part where he got in trouble for being on his phone and someone (I think it was RDJ) said that he would be able to have his “precious” phone returned to him. Instantly bringing to mind an image of a very animated-Tom Holland crouching in a cafe whispering

“Must have the precious…” as he scrolled through Tumblr.

Cue the image of RDJ in the background with an anime-style sweatdrop saying “Tom, no. Stop. Pls stop.”

We also had a discussion about Ramen. And how versatile it can be:

* Don’t have a way to heat it up/have any water to do so? Have it dry and imagine your munching on the bones of your teachers (it works best during test time)

* Feeling bitter and/or about to cry? Try Ramen cooked in the tears of bitter souls (caution: this dish may have a salty after taste)

* Feeling like some fancy pasta dish but spent too much on books and a caffeine fix? Try one of these lovely recipes and have a nice *impasta salad*

main blog

title: SotF Chapter 21 Preview
body:
Behind?  Catch up on AO3/ FFN  :)

As always, a huge hug and thank you to @stjohn27, my awesome sounding board and prereader. ❤️

“We’re you talking with Mr. Fury again today, Dad?” Peter asked.  “How’s all that going?”

Dad huffed out a sharp breath.  “Ah, you know, Pete.  Even though everything’s been reset now, Fury still thinks the Avengers should have some sort of documented rules and regulations, indicating what our criteria are for taking care of who we deem to be the bad guys.”

“But at least he’s allowing us to come up with most of it ourselves,” Steve said firmly.  “There’s no way I’d be on board with something like this otherwise, especially since we now have people like Scott and T’Challa out there who aren’t technically part of the Avengers, but who still could be if we needed them.”

“Yeah, that makes sense,” Peter said.  “So, something like a check off sheet for each mission?”

“Yeah, something like that,” said Dad.  He tripped his head back, closing his eyes.  “And a list of countries that don’t want us crossing their borders under any circumstance.  Because for whatever reason, there’s still world leaders out there who would rather try and take on their super-badass bad guys by themselves than ask us for help.”

“But even so,” Steve said, throwing Dad a look.  “We would still go in if they asked, as long as we deemed it necessary.”

“Yeah, sure, Steve,” mumbled Dad.  “It always comes down to your call, Captain.  We all trust your judgement.”

The rest of the short drive passed in silence as Peter bounced his legs, eager to get home so he could ask Dad some questions out of Steve’s—and hopefully Pepper’s—earshot.

“Hey, Dad?” Peter asked once they arrived in their Tower apartment and he’d had a chance to dump off his school stuff.  Dad had headed straight to his lab when they got home, and Steve was planning on coming back up for dinner in about an hour, so Peter knew he didn’t have much time.  “Um, can I ask you something?”

“Anytime, Pete,” Dad said, setting down the tech he was working on, which appeared to be a type of portable repulsor.  “What’s up?”

Peter looked down at his palms, picking at a piece of dead skin by his fingers.  “Um… I was wondering… if it would be okay for me to start training with the team.  You know, when we go to the Compound on weekends?”

Dad pursed his lips, narrowing his eyes.  “And why would you want to start doing that?”

“Well… because…” Peter mumbled, gulping.  “Because I think I can help.  I wanna help.  And with what I can do now, I think—”

“You think you wanna be an Avenger?”

“Well… yeah.”

“No, Pete,” said Dad, shaking his head.  “You’re a bit too young still.  Maybe when you’re older.”

“But, Dad, I can help now!  And I know if I started training with the team, I could be even better!”

“And I said no, Pete!” Dad snapped.  “You’re too young, barely even a teenager!  And yes, I know that you can climb up the walls, and that you managed to remodel the face of one of those Winter Soldiers there on the Raft, but that was a somewhat controlled situation.  It’s completely different out there in the field.  Besides.  We’re supposed to be keeping your new… skills… a secret, aren’t we?”

Anger and shame flooded Peter’s body, and he bit his lip, trying to stay calm.  He probably should’ve waited to bring this up until the Raft incident was further behind them, but who knows how many more instances like that one at the hospital would happen in the meantime?  “But, Dad, what if we shouldn’t keep it a secret?  I’m strong, even stronger than Steve.  You’ve seen what I can do, so why can’t I help?  And if you’re that concerned about keeping what I can do secret, then why couldn’t I just wear a mask or something?”

“Peter, the answer is no.  End of discussion—”

“You guys let Wanda and Pietro train, and they’re only a couple years older than me!  How am I any different?  Why should I be any different?”

“The twins train with us because Barton says that they can,” Dad barked, his brow furrowing in frustration.  “Since he’s one of their responsible adults.  And for the record, the twins are eighteen, which is an entire four years older than you, Pete.”

“Thanks, I know how to add,” Peter mumbled under his breath.

“Excuse me, child?  I didn’t quite catch that.  My ears don’t work as well as yours, remember?”

“Nothing!” grumbled Peter.  “Nevermind, it doesn’t matter.”

The full chapter will post on Monday, November 12th :)

Anger and shame flooded Peter’s body, and he bit his lip, trying to stay calm.  He probably should’ve waited to bring this up until the Raft incident was further behind them, but who knows how many more instances like that one at the hospital would happen in the meantime?  “But, Dad, what if we shouldn’t keep it a secret?  I’m strong, even stronger than Steve.  You’ve seen what I can do, so why can’t I help?  And if you’re that concerned about keeping what I can do secret, then why couldn’t I just wear a mask or something?”

“Peter, the answer is no.  End of discussion—”

“You guys let Wanda and Pietro train, and they’re only a couple years older than me!  How am I any different?  Why should I be any different?”

“The twins train with us because Barton says that they can,” Dad barked, his brow furrowing in frustration.  “Since he’s one of their responsible adults.  And for the record, the twins are eighteen, which is an entire four years older than you, Pete.”

“Thanks, I know how to add,” Peter mumbled under his breath.

“Excuse me, child?  I didn’t quite catch that.  My ears don’t work as well as yours, remember?”

“Nothing!” grumbled Peter.  “Nevermind, it doesn’t matter.”

The full chapter will post on Monday, November 12th :)
trail.content:
Behind?  Catch up on AO3/ FFN  :)

As always, a huge hug and thank you to @stjohn27, my awesome sounding board and prereader. ❤️

“We’re you talking with Mr. Fury again today, Dad?” Peter asked.  “How’s all that going?”

Dad huffed out a sharp breath.  “Ah, you know, Pete.  Even though everything’s been reset now, Fury still thinks the Avengers should have some sort of documented rules and regulations, indicating what our criteria are for taking care of who we deem to be the bad guys.”

“But at least he’s allowing us to come up with most of it ourselves,” Steve said firmly.  “There’s no way I’d be on board with something like this otherwise, especially since we now have people like Scott and T’Challa out there who aren’t technically part of the Avengers, but who still could be if we needed them.”

“Yeah, that makes sense,” Peter said.  “So, something like a check off sheet for each mission?”

“Yeah, something like that,” said Dad.  He tripped his head back, closing his eyes.  “And a list of countries that don’t want us crossing their borders under any circumstance.  Because for whatever reason, there’s still world leaders out there who would rather try and take on their super-badass bad guys by themselves than ask us for help.”

“But even so,” Steve said, throwing Dad a look.  “We would still go in if they asked, as long as we deemed it necessary.”

“Yeah, sure, Steve,” mumbled Dad.  “It always comes down to your call, Captain.  We all trust your judgement.”

The rest of the short drive passed in silence as Peter bounced his legs, eager to get home so he could ask Dad some questions out of Steve’s—and hopefully Pepper’s—earshot.

“Hey, Dad?” Peter asked once they arrived in their Tower apartment and he’d had a chance to dump off his school stuff.  Dad had headed straight to his lab when they got home, and Steve was planning on coming back up for dinner in about an hour, so Peter knew he didn’t have much time.  “Um, can I ask you something?”

“Anytime, Pete,” Dad said, setting down the tech he was working on, which appeared to be a type of portable repulsor.  “What’s up?”

Peter looked down at his palms, picking at a piece of dead skin by his fingers.  “Um… I was wondering… if it would be okay for me to start training with the team.  You know, when we go to the Compound on weekends?”

Dad pursed his lips, narrowing his eyes.  “And why would you want to start doing that?”

“Well… because…” Peter mumbled, gulping.  “Because I think I can help.  I wanna help.  And with what I can do now, I think—”

“You think you wanna be an Avenger?”

“Well… yeah.”

“No, Pete,” said Dad, shaking his head.  “You’re a bit too young still.  Maybe when you’re older.”

“But, Dad, I can help now!  And I know if I started training with the team, I could be even better!”

“And I said no, Pete!” Dad snapped.  “You’re too young, barely even a teenager!  And yes, I know that you can climb up the walls, and that you managed to remodel the face of one of those Winter Soldiers there on the Raft, but that was a somewhat controlled situation.  It’s completely different out there in the field.  Besides.  We’re supposed to be keeping your new… skills… a secret, aren’t we?”

Anger and shame flooded Peter’s body, and he bit his lip, trying to stay calm.  He probably should’ve waited to bring this up until the Raft incident was further behind them, but who knows how many more instances like that one at the hospital would happen in the meantime?  “But, Dad, what if we shouldn’t keep it a secret?  I’m strong, even stronger than Steve.  You’ve seen what I can do, so why can’t I help?  And if you’re that concerned about keeping what I can do secret, then why couldn’t I just wear a mask or something?”

“Peter, the answer is no.  End of discussion—”

“You guys let Wanda and Pietro train, and they’re only a couple years older than me!  How am I any different?  Why should I be any different?”

“The twins train with us because Barton says that they can,” Dad barked, his brow furrowing in frustration.  “Since he’s one of their responsible adults.  And for the record, the twins are eighteen, which is an entire four years older than you, Pete.”

“Thanks, I know how to add,” Peter mumbled under his breath.

“Excuse me, child?  I didn’t quite catch that.  My ears don’t work as well as yours, remember?”

“Nothing!” grumbled Peter.  “Nevermind, it doesn’t matter.”

The full chapter will post on Monday, November 12th :)

Basically a bunch of prompts about Tony Stark/the Avengers. 
(please write me some fics)

body:
Tony Stark Prompt:

“You, Stark, are a despicable person.”

“I know. It keeps me up at night.”

“Does it?”

“Every single night.”

(Idk what this is, maybe a little heart-to-heart chat between Tony and some kidnapper/villain where Tony’s insecurities come to light? Perhaps some villainy sympathy thrown in there?)

title: here and there
body:
Summary: Tony tries to get himself back in your good books after missing yet another business meeting.

Pairing: Tony Stark x Reader

Warnings: lil’ angst, flirting, fluff

Word count: 868

A/N: Written for Kari’s iron hiddles thundershield quickie challenge with the aesthetic she made below as the prompt. @until-theend-oftheline​ hosts some great quickie challenges, so if you’re ever stuck about what to write - I suggest checking her out!

“Oh, come on. Let’s talk about this,” Tony quickly followed you through the front door, trying to calm you down to no avail.

“I’m done talking,” you huffed, kicking off your heels as you made your way to the kitchen.

“This is the third time you haven’t shown up. The third!” You abruptly slammed the fridge after getting out a bottle of beer, making Tony wince.

“And I’m sorry. I really am. Something came up and I couldn’t get out of it.”

“So you keep saying,” you sighed, twisting off the bottle cap and taking a long swig.

“What’s the point of me organising these business meetings when Tony Stark, you, don’t turn up?” You pointed a finger to his chest in your frustration, “I love you, Stark, but God, you’re a nightmare to work with.”

“I’m glad you said that. I’ve got something to show you.”

Tony took the beer bottle from your hand, ignoring your protests as he put it on the side and took your hand in his before pulling you in the direction of the stairs.

“Tony, I’m not in the mood to- oh, wow,” your eyes lit up as you saw the small table set up in Tony’s work space with candles, flowers and a large cuddly bear sat on one of the chairs.

“FRIDAY, play our song,” Tony instructed, the sound of Tina Turner’s ‘What’s Love Got To Do With It’ playing out of the speakers.

It was the song that was playing when you and Tony first met at some cooperate event before he became iron man. Despite his obvious charm and reputation, you were immune to his advances at first. You didn’t want to be just another one of his hookups.

When unforeseen circumstances made you jobless, Stark offered you the job role of his PA. When you accepted the job, you never imagined the chaos that would bring. From iron man, to falling helplessly in love with your boss, you’d experienced a whole array of emotions to get to this point.

You looked over to your boyfriend with a small smile, appreciating the sentiment and effort he’d clearly put into all of this.

“How do I know FRIDAY didn’t set all this up?”

He gaped at you, offended. “I’m hurt, Y/N,” he said. “I need you to close your eyes.”

“Yeah, I’m not closing my- hey!” You scolded as Tony came up behind you, covering your eyes with his hands and leading you further into the room.

“Relax, you’re so tense,” he murmured against your ear.

“Are you surprised? Have you met you?” You retorted, worried you’d trip over your own feet any minute.

You felt Tony smile against you.

“I’ll help you with that tension later,” he smirked.

“Now, you can open your eyes.”

Tony moved his hands away, the lights taking a little time to adjust to as you saw an iron suit before you.

It was a slightly smaller than Tony’s other ones, with a little engraving of your initials inside the helmet.

You mouth fell open as you looked between the suit and Tony in disbelief.

“Is this- is this what I think it is?”

Tony nodded. “I know I was pretty against the idea of you having your own suit. I still really hope you never have to use it against anything, but I’d rather it be here, you know, just as a precaution.”

You threw your arms around him, capturing his lips in a passionate kiss, which he happily returned.

The pair of you were so immersed in one another. It was hard to think of anything else as Tony led you backwards against the worktop, various tools and parts falling to the floor as you perched on the edge, letting Tony stand between your legs.

Your fingers intertwined in the back of his hair as his tongue found yours, deepening the kiss with his hands trailing beneath your dress.

The constant buzzing from the door reluctantly made you pull away with a sigh.

“Whoever it is can wait,” Tony pouted, dropping his head to your shoulder and making you chuckle.

“Agent Coulson is at the door, Mr Stark,” FRIDAY announced. “He’s quite insistent.”

“Come on, mister. I might even get to test drive my iron suit.”

Tony’s head shot up as he gave you an unamused look, “we’ll test run it together when there isn’t some end of the world crisis.”

“Oh, Coulson isn’t here for you. He’s offering me a job at shield,” you said, patting Tony on the shoulder and shuffling off the side.

Confusion and disbelief crossed Tony’s face as he stared back at you.

“You- but- wait, what?”

You straightened out your dress, giving him a reassuring smile, “relax. It’s just a technician job. But it does mean you’ll have to find a new P.A.”

Tony wouldn’t admit he didn’t need another P.A. until a few days later, instead, he just configured FRIDAY to remind him of the odd bits and pieces.

He probably could have done that before hiring you, too, but meeting you and falling in love was the best thing he’d ever experienced and he never wanted to let you go.

“Tony, I’m not in the mood to- oh, wow,” your eyes lit up as you saw the small table set up in Tony’s work space with candles, flowers and a large cuddly bear sat on one of the chairs.

“FRIDAY, play our song,” Tony instructed, the sound of Tina Turner’s ‘What’s Love Got To Do With It’ playing out of the speakers.

It was the song that was playing when you and Tony first met at some cooperate event before he became iron man. Despite his obvious charm and reputation, you were immune to his advances at first. You didn’t want to be just another one of his hookups.

When unforeseen circumstances made you jobless, Stark offered you the job role of his PA. When you accepted the job, you never imagined the chaos that would bring. From iron man, to falling helplessly in love with your boss, you’d experienced a whole array of emotions to get to this point.

You looked over to your boyfriend with a small smile, appreciating the sentiment and effort he’d clearly put into all of this.

“How do I know FRIDAY didn’t set all this up?”

He gaped at you, offended. “I’m hurt, Y/N,” he said. “I need you to close your eyes.”

“Yeah, I’m not closing my- hey!” You scolded as Tony came up behind you, covering your eyes with his hands and leading you further into the room.

“Relax, you’re so tense,” he murmured against your ear.

“Are you surprised? Have you met you?” You retorted, worried you’d trip over your own feet any minute.

You felt Tony smile against you.

“I’ll help you with that tension later,” he smirked.

“Now, you can open your eyes.”

Tony moved his hands away, the lights taking a little time to adjust to as you saw an iron suit before you.

It was a slightly smaller than Tony’s other ones, with a little engraving of your initials inside the helmet.

You mouth fell open as you looked between the suit and Tony in disbelief.

“Is this- is this what I think it is?”

Tony nodded. “I know I was pretty against the idea of you having your own suit. I still really hope you never have to use it against anything, but I’d rather it be here, you know, just as a precaution.”

You threw your arms around him, capturing his lips in a passionate kiss, which he happily returned.

The pair of you were so immersed in one another. It was hard to think of anything else as Tony led you backwards against the worktop, various tools and parts falling to the floor as you perched on the edge, letting Tony stand between your legs.

Your fingers intertwined in the back of his hair as his tongue found yours, deepening the kiss with his hands trailing beneath your dress.

The constant buzzing from the door reluctantly made you pull away with a sigh.

“Whoever it is can wait,” Tony pouted, dropping his head to your shoulder and making you chuckle.

“Agent Coulson is at the door, Mr Stark,” FRIDAY announced. “He’s quite insistent.”

“Come on, mister. I might even get to test drive my iron suit.”

Tony’s head shot up as he gave you an unamused look, “we’ll test run it together when there isn’t some end of the world crisis.”

“Oh, Coulson isn’t here for you. He’s offering me a job at shield,” you said, patting Tony on the shoulder and shuffling off the side.

Confusion and disbelief crossed Tony’s face as he stared back at you.

“You- but- wait, what?”

You straightened out your dress, giving him a reassuring smile, “relax. It’s just a technician job. But it does mean you’ll have to find a new P.A.”

Tony wouldn’t admit he didn’t need another P.A. until a few days later, instead, he just configured FRIDAY to remind him of the odd bits and pieces.

He probably could have done that before hiring you, too, but meeting you and falling in love was the best thing he’d ever experienced and he never wanted to let you go.
trail.content_abstract:
Summary: Tony tries to get himself back in your good books after missing yet another business meeting.

Pairing: Tony Stark x Reader

Warnings: lil’ angst, flirting, fluff

Word count: 868

A/N: Written for Kari’s iron hiddles thundershield quickie challenge with the aesthetic she made below as the prompt. @until-theend-oftheline​ hosts some great quickie challenges, so if you’re ever stuck about what to write - I suggest checking her out!

“Oh, come on. Let’s talk about this,” Tony quickly followed you through the front door, trying to calm you down to no avail.

“I’m done talking,” you huffed, kicking off your heels as you made your way to the kitchen.

“This is the third time you haven’t shown up. The third!” You abruptly slammed the fridge after getting out a bottle of beer, making Tony wince.

“And I’m sorry. I really am. Something came up and I couldn’t get out of it.”

“So you keep saying,” you sighed, twisting off the bottle cap and taking a long swig.

“What’s the point of me organising these business meetings when Tony Stark, you, don’t turn up?” You pointed a finger to his chest in your frustration, “I love you, Stark, but God, you’re a nightmare to work with.”

“I’m glad you said that. I’ve got something to show you.”

fandom list | masterlist | to-do

summary:
Imagine Tony, your father, sending Happy to spy on you while you are on a date. 

[x] // requester: anonymous // request: here

...
caption:
Imagine Tony, your father, sending Happy to spy on you while you are on a date.

[x] // requester: anonymous // request: here

“Here, let me show you. Hold on. See?” Happy held his tablet up and pointed it towards the direction of your and your boyfriend’s table, where you were enjoying of a interesting conversation, still all Tony was able to see was him pointing the tablet camera at himself. 

“Look at what? You watching them?” Trying to keep it cool, Tony sighed. “Flip the screen and then we can get started, Hap.” Attempting to flip tablet camera again, Happy failed. “Just flip it. It’s not a big deal.”

Losing his temper, Happy glared down at the tablet. “I’m not a tech genius like you!” he hissed. “They were talking but now it’s getting weird. They are laughing and taking pictures of themselves with their phones. Besides, he said something about an app. And she seems to like it, Tony.”

“Relax, it’s called Instagram,” Tony reassured, knowing that you used to take pictures of yourself and post them on the social media. “Hold on a second, I’ve got an account. You’re following me, aren’t you?” he asked, furrowing his eyebrows.

“No,” he simply said. “And if I did I’m sure I would totally ignore you.”

Tony’s face hardened. However, he tried to avoid the subject and directly retorted at his friend. “Okay, hear me out, Hogan. You better flip the screen, so I can see what my daughter and that Back-Street Boy are doing,” he ordered.

blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: The bonding
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2AVLB1G

by Ruth_Cooper

After the events of all Marvel movies. Exept for “Avengers: Infinity war”. Because…you know why. Also Steve and Tony made up for their mistakes. So, the avengers are reunited.
Warnings: mentions and descriptions of self-harm; strong language; a VERY bad fanfiction.

After the events of “Thor:Ragnarok”
Thor and Loki arrived on Midgard, safe and sound. As all the asgardians were sent away to live in the different parts of the world (to the places they have chosen themselves, of course), Thor, Loki and Valkyrie were allowed to live in the Stark tower (I know it’s sold, but…).

(I have read, that Thor is 23 human years old, and Loki is 17. So be it. )

Enjoy.

Words: 1410, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence
  • Categories: F/M, M/M
  • Characters: Peter Parker, Loki (Marvel), Tony Stark, Avengers Team (MCU), Thor (Marvel), Ned Leeds, Loki’s Children (Marvel), Flash Thompson
  • Relationships: Loki & Peter Parker, Loki/Tony Stark, Loki & Thor (Marvel), Peter Parker & Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: A bad fanfiction


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2AVLB1G
